intro: Chloraea pavonii, commonly known as the rainbow flower, is a striking plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, colorful flowers that range from white to deep purple. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments and thrives in well-drained soil. Its foliage is evergreen, with lance-shaped leaves that provide a lush backdrop to its showy blooms. Chloraea pavonii is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
